result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Joshua M Knight
Current: 263 N. Charles St. Apt #3, Westfield, WI 53964 United States  (Effective: 11-16-2021)
Prior: 244 Pauquette St, Portage, WI 53901
Notice of Completion of Representation filed by Atty Riek
copy of JOC mailed to defendant returned marked, "Return to Sender, Attempted - Not Known, Unable to Forward."

Defendant Joshua M Knight in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases called: 15CT253, 15CT271, 15CM716, 16CM61, 16CF457, 16CF458, 17CM42 and 15TR4827. Rights/Elements. In 17CM42 defendant pled no contest to Ct. 2. In 16CF457 defendant pled no contest to Ct. 1. Court found guilty. Judgment was entered. All other counts in all cases dismissed and read in. In 17CM42 Court withheld sentencing, placed defendant on probation for 1 year. Conditions of probation include 30 days in jail, with Huber for work and treatment. Submit DNA sample. $443.00 costs. Maintain absolute sobriety. Psychological evaluation and comply. In 16CF457 Court withheld sentencing, placed defendant on probation for 3 years. Conditions of probation include: 3 months jail, with Huber for work and treatment, consecutive to 17CM42. Submit DNA sample. $518.00 costs. Maintain absolute sobriety. Psychological evaluation and comply. Any bond on hand will be applied towards fine/costs. Report to probation on 1-4-18. Counsel has 2 weeks to file a stipulation for jail credit due. Jail start 3-2-18 at 7 pm. May transfer to Dane County Jail. EMP approved by Court.

Time limits waived. Remaining cases, prior bonds reinstated.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 24, 2017 at 10:20 am.  Return date scheduled for March 31, 2017 at 02:45 pm.
